huntMaster.PRINT_HUNT_NAME: Any Bull Elk Units/Any Legal Weapon - Hunt #EB1010
huntMaster.SPECIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: If you obtain this permit, you may hunt on any unit designated as "any bull" take a bull elk of any size, including a spike bull. You may not hunt on spike bull units.
huntMaster.NOTES:
Baiting big game for the purposes of hunting is now illegal in Utah.
Click here for more information.

The use of all trail cameras (including both non-handheld transmitting and non-transmitting devices) in the harvest or to aid in the harvest of big game is prohibited between July 31 and Dec. 31. Click here for more information.
huntMaster.HARVEST_REPORTING: Voluntary: The DWR conducts random surveys for all general season hunts. You may be contacted via phone to participate in this survey.

huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Box Elder and Weber counties—Boundary begins at 12th Street and I-15 in Ogden; north on I-15 to the Utah/Idaho state line; west on this state line to SR-42; southeast on SR-42 to SR-30; southwest on SR-30 to township line of R15W and R16W; due south on this line to Union Pacific railroad tracks; east on these tracks(causeway) to 12th Street; east on this street to I-15 in Ogden. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Grouse Creek, Promontory Point, Tremonton. Boundary questions: Call Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Very limited, except in the Whitney reservoir area.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Chalk Creek road near Coalville, Utah. Highway 150 south of Evanston Wyoming.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kings Peak, Ogden, Salt Lake City. USFS Kamas Ranger District map
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Very Limited except for USFS land near Whitney Resivoir
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Primarily private land--Summit and Duchesne counties--Boundary begins at I-84 and I-80 near Echo; northeast on I-80 to the Utah-Wyoming state line; southeast along this state line to SR-150; south on SR-150 to Pass Lake and the Weber River trail; west on this trail to Holiday Park and CR 2596 (Weber Canyon road); west on this road to SR-32; northwest on SR-32 to I-80 at Wanship; north on I-80 to I-84 near Echo. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kings Peak, Ogden, Salt Lake City. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, (801) 476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Questions about camping and campgrounds can be answered at the Fillmore field offices of the BLM and USFS.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: The black rock road on the south end as well as several roads between Kanosh and Holden.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: There are many roads throughout the unit that can be traveled on by a truck or ATV.  There are also many roads that require an ATV or are better traveled by an ATV.  Please stay on existing roads and trails.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: There are large tracts of private land across the unit.  There is also a CWMU within the boundaries of the unit that cannot be hunted on with this tag.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Juab and Millard counties--Boundary begins at  I-15 (Exit-207) and  the Mills road; west on this road to the railroad tracks; west on these tracks to the Sevier River; north along this river to SR-132; west on SR-132 to US-50; west on US-50 to SR-257; south on SR-257 to the Black Rock road; east on this road to I-15; north on I-15 to Exit 207 and the Mills road. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Delta, Lynndyl, Manti, Nephi, Richfield. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The majority of land is managed by the BLM. The National Park Service manages Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Horse Shoe National Park. These areas are interspersed with SITLA land. There is is also private land on Mt. Ellen, Mt. Hillers, and leased land on Mt. Holmes.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: There are no DWR Wildlife Management Areas
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: There are three managed campgrounds on the Henry Mtns. Two on Mt Ellen: Lonesome Beaver and McMillan, and Mt. Hillers: Star Springs. Direct questions regarding maps and camping regulations to the Hanksville BLM Field Office. http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/richfield/recreation_/henry_mountains.html
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS:
Deer, Bison, Elk: There are several Henry Mountain access roads. Mount Ellen can be accessed on the North from the Sawmill Basin road, travel south on 100 East in Hanksville. Access to the east side of Mt Ellen is from the Little Egypt road at mile marker 20 off of SR95. Access to the west side of Ellen and Pennell is off the Notom/Burr Trail road, turn east at the Sandy Ranch. The east side of Mount Pennell and the north side of Mount Hillers can be accessed from the Coyote Benches/Stanton Pass road off of SR276. The east and south side of Mount Hillers can be accessed from the Star Springs road also off of SR276. All these roads connect with each other so there is general access to various areas across the mountain range.The BLM has put up good signage to get you around.

Desert Bighorn Sheep: Some of the best access is from Lake Powell on the east side of the unit. From the lake you can access Trachyte, Two Mile, Four Mile, Peshliki, and Ticaboo drainages. SR95 through North Wash follows along the North side of the unit and hwy 276 which travels along the west side of Mt. Holmes and Elsworth and the east side Mt. Hillers. From the map you will see a few stem roads going east off of SR276. One accesses Trachyte Point for about 3 miles where it ends above Hog Springs. Another road stems towards Mt. Holmes and Fred Ridge but this soon dead ends at a private property gate. Another road stems also to Mt. Ellsworth. Ticaboo Mesa is also accessed from SR276, this road runs along the southern side of Mt. Ellsworth and overlooks the canyon forks of Ticaboo Creek and other canyons and mesas to the North.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS:
The following link on the BLM website provides a good map of the general boundaries of the five BLM Wilderness Study Areas (WSAs) located in the hunt unit surrounding the Henry Mountains, as well as the motorized travel designations which presently exist on public lands in this area. This map is available at: https://www.blm.gov/sites/blm.gov/files/uploads/BLMUtahHenryMountainsMap.pdf
USGS maps are available at the BLM in Hanksville: USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Escalante, Hanksville, Hite Crossing, and Loa. They have a general map that labels most of the main roads. The BLM also has good road signage to help you navigate.
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO:
Emery County: http://www.emerycounty.com/road/contact.htm
Wayne County: http://www.waynecountyutah.org/
Garfield County: http://garfield.utah.gov/
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Deer and Bison: 4 wheel drive is highly recommended on the Henry Mountains. Roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM, Wayne and Garfield counties, and SITLA, and regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans. The Cave Flat road has a temporary closure November 1st – May 15th. Direct questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the Hanksville BLM Field Office, SITLA, and the county you are traveling. http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/richfield/recreation_/henry_mountains.html

Desert Bighorn: The few stem roads east off of SR276 would be best with an ATV. Direct questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the Hanksville BLM Field Office, SITLA, and the county you are traveling.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES:
The boundary excludes all of the Capital Reef National Park (CRNP). CRNP strictly regulates all hunting activity and access through the Park which is limited to the Swap Canyon trail on foot or by horse. At the end of the Cow Bison Orientation is detailed information about bison hunting and CRNP. You can see the orientation here. Contact Capital Reef National park for more information. http://www.nps.gov/care/contacts.htm

There is private property on both Mount Ellen and Mount Hillers. Mount Holmes also has private leased property. Written permission from the landowner/lessee is required by law to access and hunt private land.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Garfield, Kane and Wayne counties--Boundary begins on SR-95 at a point two miles south of Hanksville; south on SR-95 to Lake Powell; south along the west shore of Lake Powell to SR-276 at Bullfrog; north on SR-276 to the Burr Trail-Notom road; north on this road to the Capitol Reef National Park boundary; north on this boundary to the Burr Trail-Notom road at The Narrows and Divide Canyon; north on this road to a point two miles south of SR-24; east along a line that is two miles south of SR-24 to SR-95. EXCLUDES ALL NATIONAL PARKS. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Escalante, Hanksville, Hite Crossing, Loa. Boundary questions? Call the Price office, 435-613-3700.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Unit consists of primarily private land. There are several large sections of BLM land on the north west side of unit. Unit also contains multiple state owned wildlife managment areas.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: Christiensen Springs, Fountain Green, Apple Tree Springs
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: North: Big Hollow Road, South: Blue Hills Rd
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Unit consists of primarily private land.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Sanpete County--Boundary begins at SR-132 and Big Hollow Rd in Fountain Green; east and northeast on Big Hollow Rd to US-89; south on US-89 to Main St (SR-116) in Mount Pleasant; west on SR-116 to SR-132 in Moroni; north on SR-132 to Big Hollow Rd in Fountain Green. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Nephi. Boundary questions? Call the Springville office, 801-491-5678.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Campgrounds can be found on the Forest Service along the Monte Cristo Highway. Please visit https://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf for more details
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Use Hwy 39 to access Forest Service land. Use  I-84  and exit onto Henefer Rd or Echo Rd to access Henefer/Echo WMA
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Limited ATV access south of Hwy 39 on Forest Service.  No motorized vehicles on Henefer Echo WMA
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Morgan, Rich, Summit and Weber counties--Boundary begins at I-80 and the Utah-Wyoming state line; west on I-80 to Echo Junction and I-84; west on I-84 to SR-167 at Mountain Green (Trappers Loop Road); north along SR-167 to SR-39; east along SR-39 to Woodruff and SR-16; southeast on SR-16 to the Utah-Wyoming state line; south along the state line to I-80. Excludes all CWMUs. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property.  Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Logan, Ogden. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Approximately 65% public lands (BLM & USFS), 5%private and 30% tribal lands
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
There are no official campgrounds on this unit.  Camping outside of official campgrounds is permitted on most of the Forest. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service.  Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites. 
Anthro: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and BLM and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service and BLM.
Anthro: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/vernal.html
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The Anthro unit contains large amounts of Tribal Trust Lands. All ATVs are prohibited on Tribal Lands and must be trailered on access roads across Tribal Lands.  For information on which roads are legal access roads contact Duchesne County. There are also several large areas of private land on the unit, including 1 large CWMU. Hunters must receive written permission before hunting private lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Duchesne and Uintah counties—Boundary begins at US-191 and the Argyle Canyon Road; southeast on this road to the Nine Mile Canyon Road; east along this road to its end near Bulls Canyon; south from the end of this road to Nine Mile Creek; east along this creek to the Green River; north along this river to the BLM boundary near Pariette Draw; west along the BLM boundary to the Pleasant Valley Road (CR-31); west along this road to the Antelope Canyon Road (CR-27); south along this road to the Sowers Canyon Road (CR-24); south along this road to the Ute Tribal boundary; west along this boundary to the Cottonwood Ridge WMA boundary; west and north along this boundary to the Ute Tribal boundary; north and west along this road to US-191; south along US-191 to the Argyle Canyon Road. EXCLUDING ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Duchesne, Price, Seep Ridge, Vernal. Boundary questions? Call the Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
All Campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the public lands. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.
Ashley National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/ashley/home
Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/uwcnf/
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO:
Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service.
Ashley National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/detail/ashley/home/?cid=STELPRDB5432815
Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/wps/portal/fsinternet/!ut/p/c4/04_SB8K8xLLM9MSSzPy8xBz9CP0os3gjAwhwtDDw9_AI8zPwhQoY6BdkOyoCAPkATlA!/?ss=110419&navtype=BROWSEBYSUBJECT&cid=FSE_003771&navid=360000000000000&pnavid=null&position=BROWSEBYSUBJECT&ttype=main&pname=Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest- Maps & Publications
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Most areas are closed to off road vehicle use except on designated routes.  Please contact the local forest service office for more information.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: There are no Tribal lands in this unit.  There is private property and hunters should receive written permission prior to hunting on private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Daggett and Summit counties—Boundary begins at SR-150 and the Summit-Duchesne county line at Hayden Pass; north along SR-150 to the Utah-Wyoming state line; east along this state line to Flaming Gorge Reservoir main channel western shoreline (on the east side of Lucerne Point); west around Lucerne Point to the Utah-Wyoming state line (includes Lucerne Point); west along the state line to the western shore of Flaming Gorge Reservoir; south and east along this shoreline to Cart Creek; south along Cart Creek to US-191; south along US-191 to the Uintah-Daggett county line (summit of the Uinta Mountains); west along the summit of the Uinta Mountains to Hayden Pass and SR-150. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Dutch John, Kings Peak. Boundary questions? Calll the Vernal office, (435) 781-9453 o rOgden office, (801) 476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Bears are found on both BLM public and private lands throughout the year
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: There are no campgrounds in this portion of the unit, but the BLM has alot of dispersed camping locations along the roadways.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Tropic Reservoir road off of hwy 12, Glendale Bench, Hatch Bench
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: BLM and forest service travel maps
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Good access the unit for ATV's
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Garfield and Kane counties—Boundary begins at US-89A and the Utah-Arizona state line; north on US-89A to US-89; north on US-89 to SR-12; east on SR-12 to the Paria River; south along the Paria River to the Utah-Arizona state line; west along this state line to US-89A. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kanab, Panguitch. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: This area is largely private lands, but public lands do occur near and in the canyons surrounding mesa tops. The public lands are Bureau of Land Management and Utah State Institutional Trust Lands.  Tribal lands occur on the Southern portion of the sub-unit.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
This subunit is largely private lands with BLM and SITLA lands occurring in and near the canyons. There are no official campgrounds on this subunit. Camping on public lands is permitted. Please direct all questions regarding camping to the Bureau of Land Management or Utah State Institutional Trust Lands. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/monticello/recreation/activities/camping.html
SITLA: http://trustlands.utah.gov/business-groups/surface/recreational-use-of-trust-lands/
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS:
Horsehead/Coalbed/Monument Canyons – These canyons are on the Northeast side of the subunit.  Elk will travel between and bed down in these canyons during the day.
Cedar Park-Sagebrush parks with interlaced pinyon/juniper trees on the edges.  Can be a good area for the later hunts.
Cedar/Bug Point-These points contain large tracts of private property with agricultural fields.  Elk will move onto these fields during the night and can occasionally been seen during the day time.  Written permission is required to hunt these areas.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
All roads and ATV trails on this subunit are managed by the Bureau of Land Management and Utah State Institutional Trust Lands and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the BLM and SITLA.
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/prog/recreation_home/activities/ohv_riding.html
SITLA: http://trustlands.utah.gov/business-groups/surface/recreational-use-of-trust-lands/
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: There are several areas of private land on this subunit, including 2 CWMU’s (Spring Creek, Dodge and Deer Haven). Hunters must receive written permission before hunting private lands. Native American lands do occur near the Southern portion of the subunit.  General season any bull elk permits are not valid on elk CWMU’s or Native American lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: San Juan County—Boundary begins at the Utah-Colorado state line and US-491 (formerly US-666); west on US-491 to US-191; south on US-191 to the Navajo Indian Reservation boundary; east on this boundary to the Utah-Colorado state line; north on this state line to US-491. This hunt is comprised entirely of private property.  Hunters should acquire written permission from landowners before applying for this hunt. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Blanding, Bluff. Boundary questions? Call Price office, 435-613-3700.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The majority of public land is managed by the BLM which is interspersed with SITLA, and private lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: There are two DWR Wildlife Management Areas (WMA); Desert Lake and the Upper San Rafael.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
BLM campgrounds: The Wedge and Swinging Bridge. Please direct questions regarding maps and camping regulations to the Price BLM Field Office http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/price.html
State Parks campgrounds: https://stateparks.utah.gov/
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Huntington, Manti, Price, Salina, San Rafael Desert.
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO:
Carbon County: http://www.carbon.utah.gov/Departments/Road.aspx
Emery County: http://www.emerycounty.com/road/contact.htm
Sevier County: http://www.sevierutah.net/
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the respective county, BLM, and SITLA, and regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans. Direct questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the Price BLM Field Office, SITLA, and the county you are traveling.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Private property should be posted.  Written permission from the landowner/lessee is required by law to access and hunt private land.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Carbon, Emery and Sevier counties--Boundary begins at SR-10 and US-6 at Price; east and south on US-6 to I-70; west on I-70 to SR-10; north on SR-10 to US-6. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Huntington, Manti, Price, Salina, San Rafael Desert. Boundary questions? Call Price office, 435-613-3700.

huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Check with Forest Service.  Mostly just the Wastach front
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Davis, Morgan, Salt Lake and Summit counties--Boundary begins at Echo Junction and I-80; southwest along I-80 to I-15; north on I-15 to its junction with I-84 near Ogden; east on I-84 to Echo Junction. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Salt Lake City, Ogden. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Much of the high elevation habitat is privately owned.  This will impact deer and elk hunters more than pronghorn, bighorn sheep, or bison hunters.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: Cold Springs WMA east of the town of Sunnyside.  This will provide habitat for deer/elk but no opportunity for pronghorn, bighorn sheep, or bison.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
There are no developed campgrounds on this unit. Dispersed camping is allowed on most BLM and State lands.
Please direct all questions regarding maps and camping regulations to the Price BLM Field Office (http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/price.html)
BLM: 14 day camping limit and you have to move 30 miles after 14 days.
SITLA:
DWR WMA’S: UDWR WMAs is limited to 14 days at one location.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS:
Bighorn Sheep: Access Points include the Woodside Road along the Price River. This will access the top of the Beckwith Plateau but will require an ATV. Be careful crossing the Price River especially if it has rained recently. This road is found along SR-6 about 35 miles south of Price. An additional access is the Horse Canyon Road on SR-6 about 25 miles south of Price. This will provide access to the cliffs above Horse Canyon and Lila Canyon. Some hunters will drive the Hastings Road on the east side of the Green River in the town of Green River. From this road you can glass across the river to the cliffs on the west side of the river. You will obviously need some sort of boat to cross the river.

Pronghorn:Major access points include the following roads (all are accessed via SR-6); the Coal Creek Road in Wellington, the Soldier Creek Road in Wellington, the Clark Valley Road, SR-123 near Sunnyside, the Horse Canyon Road, and the Lila Canyon Road.

Mule Deer: Major access points include the Nine Mile Canyon road found at the east end of Wellington and the Bruin Point Road which is accessed via SR-123 going through the town of Sunnyside. These two roads will access much of the public lands on the West Tavaputs Plateau.

Elk: The major access points for elk hunting will be the Bruin Point road which is accessed via SR-123 through the town of Sunnyside, the Argyle Canyon road near the top of the summit of US-191 between Price and Duchesne, and the Nine Mile Canyon road out of the town of Wellington.

Bison: The Horse Canyon Road is found 25 miles south of Price on SR-6. This accesses the Range Creek area via Horse Canyon or Turtle Canyon. The Nine Mile Canyon Road in the town of Wellington will provide access to the Sand Wash Boat Ramp for floating Desolation Canyon
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO: Please consult the Carbon County website for any county road information at http://www.carbon.utah.gov/Departments/PublicLandandRoads.aspx
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM, and SITLA and regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the Price BLM Field Office, and SITLA.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES:
Bighorn Sheep: No Significant issues. Some private lands near Sunnyside and Horse Canyon.

Pronghorn: Private lands make up a small portion of pronghorn habitat, but pronghorn tend to use irrigated hayfields in late summer which are privately owned. These areas can be avoided. Some landowners provide access to hunters. Please secure permission prior to hunting. Pockets of private lands can be found in lower Coal Creek near Wellington, and portions of Icelander Wash southwest of Sunnyside.

Mule Deer and elk: the vast majority of the high elevation summer and fall habitat is on private land. There are a few small pockets of public land that can be found on the Cold Springs WMA east of Sunnyside, Cottonwood Ridge, and Harmon Canyon. Make sure you have a map or GPS depicting land ownership as there is an abundance of private land and it is essential that you know where you are.

Bison: A large part of the area where bison reside in Range Creek is managed by the Natural History Museum of Utah. You must have an access permit to be on this property and it is walk in or horseback only. Please visit https://nhmu.utah.edu/range-creek/visitor-permits to get an access permit. These permits are in short supply.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Carbon, Duchesne, and Emery counties Boundary begins at exit 164 on I-70 near the town of Green River  west on I-70 to US-6  north and west on US-6 to US-191  north on US-191 to Argyle Canyon Road  southeast on this road to Nine Mile Canyon Road  east on this road to its end near Bulls Canyon and Nine Mile Creek  east along this creek to the Green River  south along this river to Swasey’s Boat Ramp and the Hastings Road  south on this road to SR-19  south and east on SR-19 to Exit 164 on 1-70 near the town of Green River. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Huntington, Price, Seep Ridge. Boundary questions? Call Price office, 435-613-3700.

Grand County - Boundary begins at Exit 164 on I-70 near the town of Green River; east on I-70 to the Thompson Canyon road at Thompson; north on this road to the Sego Canyon road; north on this road to the Ute Indian Reservation boundary; west along this boundary to the Green River; south along this river to Swasey's Boat Ramp and the Hastings Road; south on this road to SR-19; south and east on SR-19 to Exit 164 on 1-70 near the town of Green River. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THE BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Huntington, Westwater. Boundary questions? Call the Price office, 435-613-3700

Cache and Box Elder counties--Boundary begins at I-15 and the Idaho State Line; south on I-15 to US-91 in Brigham City; east on US-91 to US-89/91; northeast on US-89/91 to US-91; north on US-91 to the Idaho State Line; west on the Idaho State Line to I-15. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Tremonton, Logan. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: Any that depict private and public lands
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO: Not a lot of road access
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Box Elder, Cache, Morgan and Weber counties—Boundary begins at US-91 and SR-101 west of Hyrum; east on SR-101 to Hardware Ranch and USFS Road 054 (Ant Flat Road); south on this road to SR-39; southwest on SR-39 to SR-167 (Trappers Loop Road); south on SR-167 to I-84 (Exit 92); west on I-84 to I-15; north on I-15 to US-91; northeast on US-91 to SR-101 west of Hyrum. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Logan, Ogden, Promontory Point. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Administered by USFS, Kamas Ranger district.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USFS Kamas Ranger district oUSGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kings Peak, Salt Lake City.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Administered by USFS, please refer to travel map for the Kamas Ranger district.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Must have written permission to access private property
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Summit and Wasatch counties—Boundary begins at I-80 and SR-32 at Wanship; south on SR-32 to Oakley and the Weber Canyon road (CR-2596); east on this road to Holiday Park and the Weber River Trail; east on this trail to SR-150 near Pass Lake; south and west on SR-150 to North Fork Provo River; south along  this river to the Provo River; south along this river to SR-35; west on SR-35 to Francis and SR-32; west on SR-32 to US-40; north on US-40 to I-80; north on I-80 to SR-32 at Wanship. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kings Peak, Salt Lake City. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Please direct all questions regarding maps and camping regulations to the Kanab and St George BLM Field Offices.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: BLM: Kanab, St George, Cedar City
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM and SITLA and regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the Kanab and St George BLM Field Office.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: This unit is largely private land.  Make sure you have written permission before entering private land.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Iron, Kane and Washington counties—Boundary begins at the Utah-Arizona state line and I-15; north on I-15 to SR-14; east on SR-14 to US-89; south on US-89 to US-89A; south on US-89A to the Utah-Arizona state line; west on this state line to I-15. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Excludes Zion National Park. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Cedar City, Kanab, Panguitch, Saint George. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Land Ownership: Public, Private, State Trust Lands (SITLA). The public lands are Bureau of Land Management (BLM) and Dixie National Forest managed out of the Cedar City and St. George Field Offices, respectively. Ninety percent of the deer habitat is on public lands. There is one CWMU on the unit. The New Harmony CWMU is for deer and turkey. Information on maps can be found at: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/res/utah_public_room/maps.print.html http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/dixie/maps-pubs
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
There are BLM and USFS campgrounds on the unit. Baker Dam campground for BLM lands is near Veyo. Some campgrounds on USFS land are Oak Grove, Honeycomb Rocks, and Pine Valley reservoir. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the BLM and the USFS. Cedar City and St. George BLM website: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/cedar_city/recreation.html
St. George Forest Service website: http://www.fs.usda.gov/activity/dixie/recreation/ohv
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: Information on maps can be found at: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/res/utah_public_room/maps.print.html http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/dixie/maps-pubs
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Stay on existing roads and trails. All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM and the Dixie National Forest and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to BLM and USFS. http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/moab/recreation/motorized_routes/ohv_designations.html http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/st__george/recreation/motorized_recreation.html http://www.fs.usda.gov/activity/dixie/recreation/ohv
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The Shivwit Piute Tribe owns a large property west of Ivins.  This is primarily on deer winter range and would only be a factor during the any weapon deer hunt.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Iron and Washington counties—Boundary begins at the Utah-Arizona state line and I-15; north on I-15 to SR-56; west on SR-56 to the Lund highway; northwest on this highway to Lund and the Union Pacific railroad tracks; southwest along these tracks to the Utah-Nevada state line; south on this state line to the Utah-Arizona state line; east on this state line to I-15. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Caliente, Cedar City, Clover Mountains, Saint George. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Land is a mixture of BLM, State and Private Lands.  Make sure you aware of where you are and obtain permission before accessing private lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Dispersed Camping is available on BLM lands, or at the Bear Lake State Park campgrounds.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Crawford Mountain Roads, Rabbit Creek, South Eden Canyon.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: BLM Administrative Maps, and Utah DWR interactive hunt map.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Access is good on county roads. See BLM's website for info on ATV use.
http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en.html
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Rich County—Boundary begins at the Utah-Idaho state line and US-89; south on US-89 to Garden City and SR-30; southeast on SR-30 to Sage Creek junction and SR-16; south on SR-16 to the Utah-Wyoming state line; north on this state line to the Utah-Idaho state line; west on this state line to US-89. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Logan, Ogden. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: There are many options for pull off camping.  West of the Sulpherdale exit is a popular area for camping.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: There are several access points off of I-15, SR-21, SR-257, and the Black Rock road.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: There are several roads and trails throughout the unit.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Most of this unit is public land.  There is private land spotted throughout the unit with most of it being around the edges of the boundary and along SR-21.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Beaver, Iron, and Millard Counties--Boundary begins at SR-130 and I-15; north on SR-130 to SR-21; north on SR-21 to SR-257; north on SR-257 to Black Rock Road; east on Black Rock Road to I-15; south on I-15 to SR-130. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Beaver, Cedar City, Panguitch, Richfield. Boundary questions? Call Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Public, Private and Tribal Lands.  The public lands are all US Forest Service lands managed by the Ashley and Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forests and some BLM land on the Bonanza portion of the unit.  This unit includes a large portion of the High Uintas Wilderness Area where all motor vehicles are prohibited.  The western portion of this unit  includes large tracks of Ute Tribal lands that are closed to non-tribal members.  The Tribal lands are mostly the lower elevation sagebrush areas but in some areas they reach up into the aspen/conifer zone.  There is a large amount of private property on the unit too.  Most of the private property is the lower elevation agricultural areas.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: Montez Creek, Kevin Conway, Stewart Lake WMAs
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
Most campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US National Forest Service. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the Forest. There are special restrictions on camping and campfires in certain areas within the Wilderness Area. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites. Ashley National Forest website: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest website: http://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf
Some campsites are also available at State Parks by Starvation, Red Fleet and Steinaker reservoirs. Questions regarding those campsites should be directed to Utah State Parks.https://stateparks.utah.gov/parks/
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: Duchense, Dutch John, Kings Peak, Vernal 1:100,000 topo maps.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the Ashley National Forest, Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest and the Vernal office of the BLM and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service or BLM.
Maps can also be purchased online at: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
http://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The hunt unit does not include Ute Tribal lands as shown on the hunt boundary map on the Division's website.  There is a large tract of Ute Tribal Trust Land that stretches east to west across the South Slope of the Uintas.  Road access across the Tribal land is permitted only across the main access roads to the Forest.  All ATVs are prohibited on Tribal Lands, they must be trailered on access roads across Tribal Lands
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Daggett, Duchesne, Uintah and Wasatch counties--Boundary begins at US-40 and SR-87 in Duchesne; north on SR-87 to SR-35; northwest on SR-35 to the Provo River; north along this river to North Fork Provo River; north along this river to SR-150; north along SR-150 to the Summit-Duchesne county line at Hayden Pass; east along this county line to the Duchesne-Daggett county line; east on this county line to the Daggett-Uintah county line; east along the Daggett-Uintah county line to US-191; north along US-191 to Cart Creek; north along Cart Creek to Flaming Gorge Reservoir; east along Flaming Gorge Reservoir to the Green River; east along the Green River to Gorge Creek; south along Gorge Creek to the USFS/private land boundary at the head of Davenport Draw; south along the USFS/private land boundary on the west side of Davenport Draw to the BLM boundary; south along the BLM boundary approximately one-third mile to the Diamond Mountain rim; south and east along the Diamond Mountain rim until the rim intersects the Diamond Mountain road (Jones Hole Road); southwest along this road to the Brush Creek road; south along this road to the Island Park/Rainbow Park road; east along this road to the Dinosaur National Monument boundary; northeast along this boundary to the Utah-Colorado state line; south along this state line to the White River; west along this river to the Green River; west along this river to the BLM boundary near Pariette Draw; west along the BLM boundary to the Pleasant Valley/Antelope Canyon road (CR-31); west along this road to the Antelope Canyon road (CR-27); south along this road to the Sowers Canyon road; south along this road to the Ute Tribal boundary; west along this boundary to the Cottonwood Ridge WMA boundary; west and north along this boundary to the Ute Tribal boundary; north and west along this boundary to Indian Canyon (US-191); north along US-191 to US-40; east on US-40 to SR-87 in Duchesne; north on SR-87 to the Duchesne River. EXCLUDING ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Duchesne, Dutch John, Kings Peak, Vernal. Boundary questions? Call the Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: All Campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and BLM. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the public lands. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO: Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by Box Elder County, the US Forest Service, or BLM and are covered on their Travel Management Plans.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service.
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/salt_lake.html
Sawtooth National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/sawtooth/
Box Elder County: http://www.boxeldercounty.org/box-elder-county-web-map.html
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: Hunters should receive written permission from private landowners prior to the start of the hunts if they wish to hunt private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Box Elder County — Boundary begins at the Lynn/Almo, Idaho road and the Utah-Idaho state line; southwest on this road through the Raft River Narrows to Lynn and the Lynn Valley road; south on this road to the Dove Creek road; southeast on this road over Dove Creek Pass to SR-30 near Rosette; northeast on SR-30 to SR-42; northwest on SR-42 to the Utah-Idaho state line; west on the state line to the Lynn/Almo, Idaho road. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Grouse Creek. Boundary questions? Call Ogden office, (801) 476-2740.

Sanpete, Millard and Juab counties – Boundary begins at I-15 and SR-28 at Nephi; south on SR-28 to US-89 in Gunnison; south on US-89 to Main St (SR-50) in Salina; northwest on SR-50 to 400 N in Scipio; west on 400 N to I-15 at Scipio; north on I-15 to SR-28 at Nephi. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Maps: Delta, Nephi, Salina. Boundary questions? Call the Springville office, 801-491-5678
